sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 31/2100Z
sections.text: TO 01/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. SMALL FLARES AND WEAK SURGING ACCOMPANIED THE LIMB TRANSIT OF REGION 7640 (N10W93). OCCASIONAL C-CLASS FLARES OCCURRED FROM REGIONS 7645 (N13E30), 7646 (S08E27), AND 7647 (S14E20), AS THE FOCUS OF ACTIVITY NOW SHIFTS TO THE EASTERN HEMISPHERE. REGION 7645 IS THE LARGEST AND MOST COMPLEX SPOT GROUP ON THE DISK.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS PREDOMINANTLY UNSETTLED AT MID- LATITUDES. HIGH LATITUDES HAD STINTS OF MINOR STORM CONDITIONS DURING LOCAL NIGHTTIME HOURS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO MILDLY ACTIVE THE NEXT 48 HOURS. QUIET TO UNSETTLED CONDITIONS SHOULD END THE INTERVAL.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 02/2100Z
sections.text: TO 03/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 7645 (N13E02) PRODUCED AN IMPULSIVE M6/0N FLARE ACCOMPANIED BY SMALL DISCRETE FREQUENCY RADIO BURSTS AT 02/2256Z. SOME DECAY HAS OCCURRED IN THE REGION TODAY, AND IT HAS BEEN VERY QUIET SINCE THE MAJOR FLARE. ELSEWHERE, TWO NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED, 7648 (N06E66), AND 7649 (S12E12). REGION 7648 HAD FREQUENT SMALL SUBFLARES DURING THE LATTER PART OF THE INTERVAL.

sections.text: LOW. HOWEVER, REGION 7645 RETAINS THE POTENTIAL FOR ANOTHER ISOLATED M-CLASS EVENT.

sections.text: TO 11/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 7648 (N07W37) PRODUCED SEVERAL SMALL C-CLASS FLARES. THIS REGION, AND ABUTTED REGION 7650 (N05W27) WERE GENERALLY STABLE. THE TRAILER OF 7648 IS INTRUDING UPON THE LEADER OF REGION 7650 CREATING HIGH MAGNETIC GRADIENTS THERE.

sections.text: LOW TO LOW. AN ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARE REMAINS A POSSIBILITY FROM THE 7648/7650 COMPLEX.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 10/2100Z TO 11/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET TO UNSETTLED UNTIL APPROXIMATELY 1500Z WHEN THE FIELD BECAME DISTURBED. MID LATITUDES WENT TO ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS. SOME HIGH LATITUDE SITES EXPERIENCED MAJOR TO SEVERE STORM CONDITIONS. THE CORONAL HOLE IN THE SOUTHWEST IS THE LIKELY SOURCE OF THIS DISTURBANCE. THE TIME OF ONSET IS SLIGHTLY EARLIER THAN EXPECTED.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD
sections.text: SHOULD BE AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS FOR 12 JAN. LOCAL NIGHTTIME SECTORS COULD EXPERIENCE MAJOR STORM CONDITIONS. NEAR ACTIVE LEVELS ARE FORECAST FOR 13-14 JAN WITH SOME MINOR STORM PERIODS POSSIBLE DURING THAT TIME.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 11/2100Z
sections.text: TO 12/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS VERY LOW WITH ONLY MINOR B-CLASS ENHANCEMENTS OBSERVED. SEVERAL OBSERVATORIES REPORTED THAT THE TRAILER SPOT OF REGION 7648 (N07W54) MERGED WITH THE LEADER SPOT OF REGION 7650 (N05W41). THIS TECHNICALLY RESULTS IN THE FORMATION OF A DELTA CONFIGURATION BUT APPARENTLY THERE IS LITTLE SHEAR IN THE AREA AS EVIDENCED BY THE LACK OF BURST ACTIVITY. A SMALL CLASS C GROUP EMERGED AT S06W18 AND WAS NUMBERED AS NEW REGION 7651.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY SHOULD BE AT A
sections.text: VERY LOW TO LOW LEVEL. THERE IS A SLIGHT CHANCE OF AN M-CLASS FLARE FROM THE 7648/7650 COMPLEX BUT THAT POSSIBILITY IS DIMINISHED. OLD REGION 7640 IS DUE TO RETURN TO THE EAST LIMB NEAR N08 ON 15 JAN. THIS REGION PRODUCED 7 M-CLASS AND 62 C-CLASS FLARES LAST ROTATION AND FADED FROM VIEW AS A LARGE REGION WITH MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY. THIS REGION COULD RETURN AS AN M-CLASS FLARE PRODUCER.

sections.text: SHOULD BE UNSETTLED TO SLIGHTLY ACTIVE FOR 13-14 JAN AS THE CORONAL HOLE RELATED DISTURBANCE SUBSIDES. ISOLATED STORM CONDITIONS ARE POSSIBLE DURING THAT PERIOD. MOSTLY UNSETTLED LEVELS ARE FORECAST FOR 15 JAN.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 12/2100Z
sections.text: TO 13/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY REMAINED VERY LOW. ONLY MINOR B-CLASS ENHANCEMENTS WERE OBSERVED FROM REGION 7650 (N05W55) AND 7648 (N07W68). REGION 7648 EXHIBITED SOME DECAY. THE MAUNA LOA OBSERVATORY REPORTED A CORONAL MASS EJECTION FROM NEAR N13E90 BETWEEN 12/1930-2200Z. NO SIGNIFICANT X-RAY OR RADIO ENHANCEMENTS WERE OBSERVED DURING THAT TIME. THE EJECTION LIKELY OCCURRED FROM OLD REGION 7640 WHICH SHOULD BE NEARING THE EAST LIMB AT THOSE LATITUDES. YOHKOH IMAGES SHOW A BROAD AREA OF DIFFUSE X-RAY EMISSION AT THE NORTHEAST LIMB WITH SMALL BRIGHTER STREAMERS.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY SHOULD INCREASE
sections.text: OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS AS PREVIOUSLY ACTIVE LONGITUDES ROTATE INTO VIEW. THE POSSIBILITY OF M-CLASS ACTIVITY EXISTS FROM THIS AREA. A BETTER ASSESSMENT WILL BE POSSIBLE ONCE OLD REGION 7640 (AND OTHERS NEARBY) BECOME VISIBLE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 12/2100Z TO 13/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS GENERALLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE AS THE CORONAL HOLE RELATED DISTURBANCE CONTINUED. AS IN PREVIOUS DAYS, SOME SITES EXPERIENCED PERIODS OF MINOR TO MAJOR STORM CONDITIONS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD
sections.text: SHOULD CONTINUE AT UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR 14 JAN. MOSTLY UNSETTLED LEVELS ARE FORECAST FOR 15-16 JAN. ISOLATED ACTIVE CONDITIONS ARE POSSIBLE DURING THAT TIME AS THE DISTURBANCE SLOWLY SUBSIDES.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 13/2100Z
sections.text: TO 14/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY BECAME LOW. REGION 7648 (N07W79) PRODUCED A C1/SF AT 0916Z. ANOTHER C1 OCCURRED AT 1612Z AND WAS COINCIDENT IN TIME WITH THE BEGINNING OF AN ACTIVE SURGE REGION NEAR NE05. THE DELTA CONFIGURATION IN REGION 7650 (N05W67) APPEARS TO HAVE FADED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY SHOULD CONTINUE
sections.text: GENERALLY LOW WITH THE EMPHASIS SHIFTING FROM THE WEST LIMB TO THE NEW REGION AT THE EAST LIMB. DUE TO THE LACK OF FREQUENT BURST ACTIVITY, IT IS LIKELY OLD REGION 7640 WILL NOT BE AS ACTIVE THIS ROTATION AS IT WAS LAST ROTATION.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS GENERALLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE. INTERMITTENT MINOR TO MAJOR STORM PERIODS WERE OBSERVED AT SOME HIGH LATITUDE SITES.

sections.text: SHOULD CONTINUE UNSETTLED TO SLIGHTLY ACTIVE FOR 15-16 JAN. HIGH LATITUDES SHOULD EXPECT ISOLATED STORM CONDITIONS. MOSTLY UNSETTLED LEVELS ARE PREDICTED FOR 17 JAN.

sections.text: TO 15/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW.  NUMEROUS HIGH B-CLASS AND LOW C-CLASS FLARING OCCURRED THIS PERIOD, ALL OPTICALLY UNCORRELATED.  REGION 7648 ROTATED OFF THE DISK.  TWO NEW REGIONS WERE NUMBERED TODAY.  REGION 7652 (N05E72) HERALDS THE RETURN OF OLD REGION 7640.  EVENT LEVEL SURGING PRECEDED ITS RETURN.  REGION 7653 (S05W82) IS THE OTHER NEW NUMBERED REGION.  AT THE MOMENT, ALL REGIONS APPEAR STABLE.

sections.text: LOW.  REGION 7652 WILL BE THE REGION TO WATCH FOR THE NEXT FEW DAYS AS IT ROTATES ONTO THE DISK FURTHER.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 15/2100Z
sections.text: TO 16/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW.  ACTIVITY THIS PERIOD CONSISTED OF TWO OPTICALLY UNCORRELATED C-CLASS EVENTS (C1.1 AND C8.5), A C1.4 SUBFLARE FROM NEWLY NUMBERED REGION 7654 (N08E74), AND LIMB SURGING, AGAIN FROM 7654.  WHITE LIGHT REPORTS INDICATE THIS REGION HAS DEVELOPED INTO A BETA-GAMMA AS IT SLOWLY ROTATES ONTO THE DISK.  REGION 7655 (S07W24) WAS ALSO NUMBERED LAST NIGHT.  REGIONS 7650 AND 7653 ROTATED OFF THE DISK.  ALL OTHER REGIONS ARE STABLE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO
sections.text: REMAIN LOW.  REGION 7654 CONTINUES TO GROW AS IT ROTATES ONTO THE DISK AND OFFERS THE GREATEST PROBABILITY FOR C- CLASS AND POSSIBLE M-CLASS ACTIVITY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 16/2100Z
sections.text: TO 17/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH.  REGION 7654 (N08E55) PRODUCED TWO IMPRESSIVE FLARES LAST NIGHT.  THE FIRST WAS AN M6/1N WHICH PEAKED AT 16/2325Z.  OPTICAL REPORTS INDICATED A Y-SHAPED RIBBON CHARACTERISTIC WITH THE FLARE.  RADIO EMISSION RAN FROM 245MHZ TO 15400MHZ TO INCLUDE A 190SFU TENFLARE AND 2.2E+05 START-TO-PEAK INTEGRATED FLUX FROM 8800MHZ.  A TYPE II SWEEP WITH AN ESTIMATED SHOCK VELOCITY OF 400 KM/SEC WAS ALSO REPORTED.  THE SECOND FLARE WAS A C9/1N WITH WEAK RADIO EMISSION IN THE UPPER WAVELENGTHS.  THIS FLARE PEAKED AT 17/0919Z. WEAKER C-CLASS FLARING HAS OCCURRED SINCE THE C9.  REGION 7654 HAS SHOWN SOME GROWTH IN PAST 24 HOURS WHILE MAINTAINING A RELATIVELY COMPLEX INVERSION LINE.  THE OTHER SPOTTED REGION 7652 (N04E42) HAS BEEN STABLE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS FORECAST TO
sections.text: BE LOW TO MODERATE.  REGION 7654 SHOULD CONTINUE TO PRODUCE C-CLASS AND SOME M-CLASS ACTIVITY FOR THE FORESEEABLE FUTURE.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO ACTIVE LEVELS IN THE MIDDLE LATITUDES FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS.  HIGH LATITUDES HAVE BEEN AT MOSTLY ACTIVE LEVELS WITH SOME MINOR STORMING.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 17/2100Z
sections.text: TO 18/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW.  REGION 7654 (N08E46) REMAINS THE MOST ACTIVE REGION ON THE DISK.  FIVE OPTICALLY UNCORRELATED C-CLASS FLARES WERE OBSERVED THIS PERIOD, MOST LIKELY ORIGINATING FROM THIS REGION.  MAGNETIC INVERSION LINE ANALYSIS INDICATES 7654 HAS DEVELOPED A BETA-GAMMA-DELTA CONFIGURATION WHILE MAINTAINING ITS OVERALL SIZE AND SHAPE. REGION 7656 (S22W08) WAS NUMBERED THIS PERIOD HAS AN AXX SPOT GROUP.  ALL OTHER REGIONS QUIET AND STABLE.

sections.text: LOW.  REGION 7654 IS FORECAST TO CONTINUE PRODUCING C-CLASS, AND POSSIBLY M-CLASS ACTIVITY.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT MOSTLY UNSETTLED LEVELS WITH SOME MINOR STORMING EXPERIENCED FROM 18/14Z-17Z AT MIDDLE LATITUDES.  LEVELS HAVE BEEN QUIET TO UNSETTLED SINCE.  HIGH LATITUDES WERE AT MOSTLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS WITH SOME MAJOR TO SEVERE STORM LEVELS RECORDED FROM 18/14Z-17Z.  LEVELS HAVE CALMED DOWN TO MOSTLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE SINCE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 20/2100Z
sections.text: TO 21/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS VERY LOW. REGION 7654 (N08E09) PRODUCED SEVERAL SUBFLARES AND APPEARS TO BE ROTATING COUNTERCLOCKWISE, BUT HAS REMAINED MOSTLY STABLE IN WHITE LIGHT AND H-ALPHA.  NEW REGION 7657 (N12W20) EMERGED RAPIDLY ON THE DISK.  IT IS MAGNETICALLY SIMPLE BUT WITH AN EAST-WEST INVERSION LINE. A DARK FILAMENT NEAR S23W03 DISAPPEARED BETWEEN 1747 AND 2015 UT.

sections.text: LOW.  ERUPTIVE EVENTS ARE EXPECTED FROM REGION 7654 AND POSSIBLY FROM 7657, IF RAPID GROWTH CONTINUES IN THAT REGION.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT MOSTLY QUIET LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. ACTIVITY THAT WAS EXPECTED FROM AN ISOLATED, EQUATORIAL CORONAL HOLE HAS NOT OCCURRED.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO PERSIST AT QUIET TO OCCASIONALLY UNSETTLED LEVELS THROUGHOUT THE FORECAST PERIOD. TODAY'S FILAMENT DISAPPEARANCE WILL BE EVALUATED FOR POSSIBLE EFFECTS ON 25-26 JANUARY.

TWO NEW REGIONS WERE NUMBERED. REGION 7658 (N12E16) IS A SIMPLE BIPOLAR GROUP. REGION 7659 (S13E47) WAS SPOTTED BRIEFLY BUT IS PRESENTLY ONLY PLAGE AND AN ARCH FILAMENT SYSTEM. sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 25/2100Z
sections.text: TO 26/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE.  REGION 7654 (N08W63) PRODUCED A LONG DURATION M1/SF FLARE AT 26/0136.  THE EVENT WAS PRECEDED BY A C2/SF WHICH PEAKED AT 26/0118 AND WAS FOLLOWED BY A C6/SF WHICH PEAKED AT 26/0200.  THE REGION CONTINUES TO SHOW GROWTH AS IT APPROACHES THE WEST LIMB.  REGIONS 7658 (N12W38) AND 7661 (N08E11) HAVE ALSO SHOWN SOME GROWTH THIS PERIOD.  ALL OTHER REGIONS ARE STABLE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE DUE TO THE CONTINUED GROWTH OF REGIONS 7654, 7658, AND 7661.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO MOSTLY ACTIVE LEVELS WITH A BRIEF PERIOD OF MINOR STORMING OCCURRING DURING THE 06-09Z PERIOD AT MIDDLE LATITUDES AND MINOR TO MAJOR STORMING OCCURRING DURING THE 12-18Z TIME FRAME AT HIGHER LATITUDES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE NEXT TWO DAYS DUE TO A FAVORABLY POSITIONED CORONAL HOLE.  LEVELS SHOULD BE QUIET TO UNSETTLED ON DAY THREE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 27/2100Z
sections.text: TO 28/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 7654 (N08W90) PRODUCED AN M1/OF LIMB FLARE AT 1704Z. THIS EVENT REGISTERED A SECONDARY MAX OF M1 AT 1852Z. POST-FLARE LOOPS WERE SEEN TO FOLLOW THIS ACTIVITY. BRIGHT SURGING WAS COMMONPLACE ON THE WEST LIMB ALL DAY. ELSEWHERE, NEW REGION 7662 (S15E36) EMERGED, AND POINT BRIGHTENINGS WERE SEEN IN AN AS YET UNNUMBERED REGION NOW POSITIONED NEAR S08E79. AN EIGHT DEGREE-LONG SECTION OF THE LARGE N-S FILAMENT LOCATED NEAR DISK CENTER DISAPPEARED BY MIDWAY THROUGH THE INTERVAL.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. REGION 7654 IS CAPABLE OF YET ANOTHER M-CLASS FLARE AS A PARTING SHOT.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED THROUGHOUT THE INTERVAL.

sections.text: TO 29/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. TWO UNASSOCIATED M-2 X-RAY FLARES OCCURRED, AT 0413Z AND AT 1129Z. THE LIKELY SOURCE OF THIS ACTIVITY IS NOW-DEPARTED REGION 7654, A DAY PAST WEST LIMB AT N09. SURGING WAS SEEN AT THIS LATITUDE MOST OF THE DAY. APART FROM THIS, LITTLE OF SIGNIFICANCE OCCURRED ON THE VISIBLE DISK. REGION 7658 (N08W76) DID MUSTER A C6/0F FLARE AT 0905Z. THE REGION IS NOW REPORTED TO BE IN DECAY.

sections.text: LOW. REGION 7654 MAY STILL RECORD A SMALL M-CLASS EVENT IN THE NEAR TERM.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED. EPISODES OF ACTIVE CONDITIONS ARE POSSIBLE ON 01 FEB IF EFFECTS OF YESTERDAY'S SMALL DISAPPEARING FILAMENT MATERIALIZE.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS PREDOMINANTLY QUIET. SOME HIGH LATITUDE STATIONS EXPERIENCED ISOLATED ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM CONDITIONS BUT THIS LEVEL OF DISTURBANCE WAS NOT OBSERVED GLOBALLY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD
sections.text: SHOULD BE MOSTLY QUIET FOR 05 FEB. UNSETTLED CONDITIONS ARE FORECAST FOR 06 FEB. BEGINNING ON 07 FEB, THE CORONAL HOLE RELATED DISTURBANCE EXPERIENCED LAST ROTATION SHOULD RECUR. THIS LONG-LIVED DISTURBANCE RESULTED IN DAILY A INDICES IN THE ACTIVE RANGE WITH SOME K INDICES IN THE MINOR TO SEVERE STORM RANGE. SIMILAR CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED THIS ROTATION. THE MODERATE TO HIGH FLUXES OF ENERGETIC ELECTRONS OBSERVED WITH THIS DISTURBANCE LAST ROTATION SHOULD ALSO RECUR.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 04/2100Z
sections.text: TO 05/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS VERY LOW. ONLY MINOR ENHANCEMENTS WERE OBSERVED. A SMALL REGION EMERGED NEAR S07E42 AND WAS NUMBERED AS REGION 7667. THE LEADING EDGE OF THE LARGE SOUTHERN CORONAL HOLE IS NEAR W35 AT THIS TIME.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY SHOULD CONTINUE
sections.text: AT A VERY LOW LEVEL FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 04/2100Z TO 05/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET TO UNSETTLED UNTIL NEAR 1030Z WHEN GENERALLY ACTIVE CONDITIONS BEGAN. HIGH LATITUDE SITES EXPERIENCED MAJOR TO SEVERE STORM LEVELS (K6, K7) DURING 1030Z-1800Z.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD
sections.text: SHOULD RANGE FROM UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE FOR 06 FEB. THE CORONAL HOLE RELATED DISTURBANCE SHOULD BEGIN LATE ON 06 FEB AND CONTINUE THROUGH APPROXIMATELY 11 FEB. ONCE THIS DISTURBANCE BEGINS, GENERALLY ACTIVE CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED. THERE WILL BE PERIODS OF MINOR TO MAJOR STORMING AT MID LATIDUES AND MAJOR TO SEVERE STROMING AT HIGH LATITUDES.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 05/2100Z
sections.text: TO 06/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY CONTINUED VERY LOW. REGION 7664 (S11W34) GREW AT A MODERATE PACE AND PRODUCED TWO MID LEVEL B-CLASS SUBFLARES. A STRONG ARCH FILAMENT SYSTEM WAS OBSERVED HERE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY SHOULD CONTINUE
sections.text: AT A VERY LOW LEVEL. CONTINUED GROWTH IN REGION 7664 COULD RESULT IN AN ISOLATED C-CLASS FLARE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 05/2100Z TO 06/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS MOSTLY ACTIVE UNTIL A MAJOR DISTURBANCE BEGAN NEAR 06/1000Z. MAJOR STORM CONDITIONS ENSUED AT MID LATITUDES AND MAJOR TO SEVERE STORM LEVELS WERE DETECTED AT HIGH LATITUDES. A FORBUSH DECREASE OF APPROXIMATELY 5 PERCENT WAS OBSERVED NEAR 06/0600Z. THE GOES 6 SPACECRAFT AT 85W EXPERIENCED MAGNETOPAUSE CROSSINGS AT 06/1620-1632Z AND 06/1709-1713Z. THE ONLY SOURCE FOR THIS DISTURBANCE IS A FILAMENT DISRUPTION ON 01 FEB NEAR S35E01. THE FORBUSH DECREASE AND THE SEVERITY OF THIS DISTURBANCE ARGUE AGAINST THE EARLY ARRIVAL OF THE CORONAL HOLE EFFECTS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD
sections.text: SHOULD CONTINUE AT MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS FOR EARLY 07 FEB. THE CORONAL HOLE STREAM SHOULD ESTABLISH ITSELF IN THE EARTH'S VICINITY DURING 07 FEB AND GEOMAGNETIC CONDITIONS SHOULD MODERATE SOMEWHAT. ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM CONDITIONS ARE FORECAST FOR 08-09 FEB. ISOLATED PERIODS AT MAJOR STORM ARE POSSIBLE DURING THAT PERIOD FOR MID LATITUDES AND HIGH LATITUDES COULD EXPERIENCE PERIODS AT SEVERE STORM.

sections.text: TO 08/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY REMAINED VERY LOW. NEW REGION 7668 (N09E50) EMERGED RAPIDLY AND PRODUCED SEVERAL OPTICAL FLARES WITH B-CLASS ENHANCEMENTS. REGION 7664 (S14W62), WHICH WAS GROWING RAPIDLY ON 07 FEB, STABILIZED DURING THE PERIOD. A LACK OF DATA IS INHIBITING ANALYSIS.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY SHOULD BECOME
sections.text: GENERALLY LOW. REGION 7668 IS BECOMING A LIKELY CANDIDATE FOR LOW C-CLASS SUBFLARES. OLD REGION 7654 IS DUE AT THE EAST LIMB AT THE END OF THE PERIOD AND SHOULD START TO ELEVATE ACTIVITY LEVELS AT THAT TIME. LAST ROTATION, REGION 7654 PRODUCED FOUR M-CLASS AND MANY C-CLASS EVENTS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 07/2100Z TO 08/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS AT ACTIVE TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS. SOME HIGH LATITUDE SITES EXPERIENCED SEVERE STORM CONDITIONS. THE SEVERITY OF THIS DISTURBANCE APPEARED TO BE MODERATING TOWARD THE END OF THE PERIOD. MORE FREQUENT ACTIVE TO UNSETTLED K INDICES WERE OBSERVED AT VARIOUS OBSERVATORIES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD
sections.text: SHOULD BECOME PREDOMINANTLY ACTIVE FOR THE DURATION OF THE FORECAST PERIOD. OCCASIONAL MINOR TO MAJOR STORM PERIODS ARE LIKELY. THE CORONAL HOLE RESPONSIBLE FOR THIS DISTURBANCE IS QUITE ELONGATED AND DISTURBED GEOMAGNETIC CONDITIONS SHOULD BE EXPECTED FOR APPROXIMATELY ONE WEEK.

sections.text: TO 09/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW.  REGION 7668 (N08E35) WAS THE MOST ACTIVE THIS PERIOD PRODUCING SEVERAL OPTICAL FLARES WITH B-CLASS ENHANCEMENTS WHILE SHOWING GOOD WHITE LIGHT GROWTH. A FAVORABLY POSITIONED CORONAL HOLE IS BELIEVED TO BE RESPONSIBLE FOR THE STORM CONDITIONS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD
sections.text: SHOULD REMAIN AT MOSTLY ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE DURATION OF THE FORECAST PERIOD.  OCCASIONAL PERIODS OF MINOR TO MAJOR STORMS ARE STILL LIKELY.  DISTURBED GEOMAGNETIC CONDITIONS SHOULD BE EXPECTED FOR THE NEXT SIX DAYS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 19/2100Z
sections.text: TO 20/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 7671 (N09W15) PRODUCED AN M4/3B FLARE EARLY IN THE PERIOD. THE EVENT ATTAINED MAXIMUM AT 0141Z, AND INCLUDED TYPES II AND IV SWEEP, AS WELL AS A BURST OF 190 SFU AT 2695 MHZ. THE LARGE CIRCULAR FILAMENT LOCATED AT THE PERIMETER OF THE REGION OVER THE PAST FEW DAYS, DISAPPEARED DURING THE ACTIVITY, AND THE MAIN SPOT HAS SINCE FRAGMENTED INTO AT LEAST TWO PIECES. SINCE THIS IMPULSIVE FLARE, THE REGION HAS DONE LITTLE OF SIGNIFICANCE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW. ADDITIONAL M-CLASS ACTIVITY IS NOT EXPECTED FROM REGION 7671.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 19/2100Z TO 20/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO ACTIVE LEVELS. A SATELLITE PROTON EVENT AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV BEGAN AT 0300Z. THIS ACTIVITY IS ATTRIBUTABLE TO THE FLARE/CME EVENT FROM REGION 7671 AT 0141Z. A SHARP ONSET, TYPICAL OF WELL- CONNECTED EVENTS, PRECEDED A PEAK OF 74 PFU AT 0915Z. THE FLUXES HAVE DECAYED SLIGHTLY DURING THE DAY, BUT STILL HOVER NEAR THE 50 PFU LEVEL. A SMALL SIGNATURE AT GREATER THAN 100 MEV WAS ALSO SEEN, ROUGHLY ONE ORDER OF MAGNITUDE ABOVE BACKGROUND. EQUIPMENT PROBLEMS AT THULE PROHIBIT A PRECISE ASSESSMENT OF A POLAR CAP ABSORPTION, BUT OTHER DATA SUGGEST IT MAY BE ON THE ORDER OF 3-4 DB. THIS IS THE FIRST SOLAR PROTON EVENT SINCE MARCH, 1993.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE FOR THE NEXT 24 HOURS. FLARE/CME EFFECTS ARE EXPECTED TO DOMINATE THE LAST 48 HOURS WHEN MINOR STORM CONDITIONS SHOULD PREVAIL. EPISODES OF MAJOR STORMING AT ALL LATITUDES ARE DISTINCTLY POSSIBLE. PROTON FLUXES ARE NOT EXPECTED TO INCREASE WITH THE PASSAGE OF A SHOCK, EXPECTED EARLY ON FEB. 22. THE SLOW DECAY IS LIKELY TO PERSIST THROUGHOUT THE FORECAST PERIOD.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 20/2100Z
sections.text: TO 21/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS VERY LOW. REGION 7671 (N10W28) CONTINUES TO BE SOMNOLENT SINCE ITS M4/3B FLARE OF 20 FEB. WEATHER HAS HAMPERED PATROL THE PAST 24 HOURS, BUT THE FEW REPORTS RECEIVED INDICATE CONTINUED DECAY IN THAT REGION. A NEW AS YET UNNUMBERED REGION MAY BE COMING INTO VIEW IN THE NORTHEAST.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 20/2100Z TO 21/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD BEGAN THE PERIOD AT QUIET TO UNSETTLED CONDITIONS. THE PASSAGE OF A SHOCK, THOUGHT GENERATED BY A CME ASSOCIATED WITH THE M4/3B FLARE YESTERDAY, BROUGHT MAJOR STORMING IMMEDIATELY AFTER THE SUDDEN COMMENCEMENT MEASURING 92 NANOTESLA AT BOULDER AT 0900Z. FLUXES OF GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTONS INCREASED DRAMATICALLY WITH THE PASSAGE OF THIS UNUSUALLY FAST SHOCK, REACHING 10,000 PFU ALSO AT 0900Z. THOSE FLUXES HAVE STEADILY DECLINED SINCE, AND ARE NOW NEAR 10 PFU. THE TRANSIT TIME FOR THIS SHOCK WAS A SHORT 31 HOURS. DURING THE TIME PERIOD 1200-1800Z, THE POLAR CAP ABSORPTION EVENT REGISTERED LEVELS IN THE NEIGHBORHOOD OF 15 DB. A FORBUSH DECREASE OF APPROXIMATELY 5 PERCENT BEGAN MIDWAY THROUGH THE DAY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO PERSIST AT MAJOR TO SEVERE STORM LEVELS FOR THE NEXT 24 HOURS. THE DISTURBANCE SHOULD GRADUALLY ABATE OVER TIME, GIVING WAY TO UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE CONDITIONS BY FEBRUARY 24. THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTONS ARE LIKELY TO RETURN TO BACKGROUND VALUES OVER THE NEXT 24-36 HOURS.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT MOSTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS UNTIL 07/03Z WHEN THE FIELD BECAME DISTURBED. CONDITIONS SINCE 07/03Z HAVE BEEN MOSTLY ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM AT MIDDLE LATITUDES AND ACTIVE TO MAJOR STORM AT HIGH LATITUDES.  PERIODS OF SEVERE STORM LEVELS WERE RECORDED AT 07/18Z AT HIGH LATITUDES.  THIS GEOMAGNETIC STORM IS BELIEVED TO BE CAUSED BY A FAVORABLY POSITIONED CORONAL HOLE. RECURRENCE INDICATES THIS HOLE HAS PERSISTED FOR SEVERAL ROTATIONS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO REMAIN DISTURBED FOR THE REMAINDER OF THIS FORECAST PERIOD.  ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM CONDITIONS WITH ISOLATED PERIODS OF MAJOR STORM LEVELS WILL PERSIST AT MID LATITUDES.  ACTIVE TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS WITH SOME SEVERE STORM LEVELS CAN BE EXPECTED AT HIGH LATITUDES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  AT MIDDLE LATITUDES, THE
sections.text: GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED ON DAY'S ONE AND TWO BECOMING ACTIVE ON DAY THREE.  AT HIGH LATITUDES, THE FIELD IS EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED ON DAY ONE, MOSTLY ACTIVE ON DAY TWO WITH ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM CONDITIONS LIKELY ON DAY THREE.  A FAVORABLY POSITIONED RECURRENT CORONAL HOLE FEATURE IS EXPECTED TO PRODUCE THE ACTIVITY BEGINNING ON DAY TWO WITH ACTIVE TO STORM CONDITIONS LIKELY TO PERSIST THROUGH 11 APRIL.

THE STORM CONDITIONS ARE BELIEVED TO BE A RESULT OF A FAVORABLY POSITIONED RECURRENT CORONAL HOLE. THE GT 2MEV ELECTRON FLUX REACHED HIGH LEVELS AT 03/1845Z.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO REMAIN AT MOSTLY ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS AT MIDDLE LATITUDES AND ACTIVE TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS AT HIGH LATITUDES.  ISOLATED PERIODS OF MAJOR STORM LEVELS AT MID LATS AND SEVERE STORM LEVELS AT HIGH LATS CAN BE EXPECTED.  BASED ON RECURRENCE, THESE CONDITIONS ARE FORECAST FOR THE ENTIRE PERIOD AND CAN BE EXPECTED TO PERSIST THROUGH 9 APRIL.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 13/2100Z
sections.text: TO 14/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS VERY LOW. CERTAINLY THE MOST INTERESTING EVENT OF THE DAY ESCAPED DETECTION IN H-ALPHA AND SOFT X-RAYS, BUT WAS DRAMATIC IN X-RAY IMAGERY. A LARGE VOLUME OF THE SOUTH-SOUTHEAST QUADRANT WAS SEEN TO DRAMATICALLY RESTRUCTURE DURING THE FIRST 5-6 HOURS OF THE DAY. THIS EVENT SUGGESTS A LARGE-SCALE CORONAL MASS EJECTION, EXTENDING TO NEAR THE ECLIPTIC PLANE. JUST A VERY SMALL FILAMENT DISAPPEARED AS PART OF THE EVENT. ELSEWHERE, LITTLE FLARE ACTIVITY OCCURRED. ONE NEW REGION, 7701 (N05E77), ROTATED INTO VIEW AS A MATURE SUNSPOT.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 15/2100Z TO 16/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD RANGED FROM QUIET TO MINOR STORM LEVELS DURING THE PAST 24 HOURS. DURING LOCAL NIGHTTIME HOURS (15/2100 - 16/0900Z) THE FIELD WAS AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS WITH SOME HIGH LATITUDE MAJOR STORM PERIODS. CONDITIONS MODERATED THEREAFTER UNTIL ABOUT 2030Z WHEN A MARKED INCREASE TO STRONGLY ACTIVE CONDITIONS OCCURRED. THIS MAY MARK THE ARRIVAL OF THURSDAY'S CORONAL MASS EJECTION.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT MOSTLY MINOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE NEXT TWO DAYS: CONDITIONS ARE LIKELY TO INTENSIFY DURING LOCAL NIGHT- TIMES WITH SOME PERIODS OF MAJOR STORM LEVELS, AND ARE LIKELY TO MODERATE SOMEWHAT DURING LOCAL DAYTIME HOURS. CONDITIONS SHOULD SUBSIDE TO PREDOMINANTLY ACTIVE BY THE THIRD DAY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 16/2100Z TO 17/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD RANGED FROM QUIET TO SEVERE STORM LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. YESTERDAY'S DISTRUBANCE INTENSIFIED TO MAJOR TO SEVERE LEVELS FROM 0000-1200UT WITH K'S OF 9 REPORTED AT SOME HIGH LATITUDE SITES. NOAA/SESC RECEIVED NUMEROUS REPORTS OF AURORAL SIGHTINGS. CONDITIONS DROPPED OFF AROUND 1200Z AND BECAME QUIET TO UNSETTLED NEAR DAY'S END. THE GREATER THAN 2 MEV ELECTRON FLUENCES WERE AT HIGH LEVELS EARLY IN THE DAY BUT DROPPED DOWN TO NORMAL BACK- GROUND LEVELS AROUND 0500Z.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE NEXT 12 TO 24 HOURS: THE MORE DISTURBED PERIODS ARE LIKELY TO OCCUR DURING LOCAL NIGHTTIMES AND LESS DISTURBED DURING DAYTIME HOURS. CONDITIONS ARE LIKELY TO REMAIN AT ACTIVE LEVELS THROUGH THE SECOND AND THIRD DAYS AS A CORONAL HOLE WILL BE IN FAVORABLE POSITION AT THAT TIME.

sections.text: TO 01/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS VERY LOW. sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS MOSTLY QUIET TO ACTIVE WITH SOME PERIODS OF STORM CONDITIONS AT HIGH LATITUDES. AN INITIALLY QUIET FIELD BECAME DISTURBED AFTER 0600Z: MID-LATITUDES HAVE BEEN ACTIVE AND HIGH LATITUDES HAVE FLUCTUATED BETWEEN ACTIVE AND MAJOR STORM LEVELS. sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 10/2100Z
sections.text: TO 11/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS VERY LOW.  NO SIGNIFICANT EVENTS WERE OBSERVED THE PAST 24 HOURS.  NEW REGION 7722 (N07E81, CARR LO 122) WAS NUMBERED THIS PERIOD AS A DHO BETA GROUP WITH 4 SPOTS.  RGN 7722 APPEARS TO HERALD THE RETURN OF OLD RGN 7701 (CARR LO 120) WHICH PRODUCED ONLY WEAK ACTIVITY ITS LAST PASS.  ALL OTHER REGIONS HAVE EXHIBITED SLOW DECAY.  TWO FILAMENTS DISAPPEARED THIS PERIOD:  A 10 DEGREE LONG FILAMENT CENTERED AT N34E30 AND A 19 DEGREE LONG FILAMENT CENTERED AT S35W24.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 11/2100Z
sections.text: TO 12/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS VERY LOW, HOWEVER, NUMEROUS ACTIVITY WAS REPORTED LAST PERIOD.  A TOTAL OF 16 B-CLASS X-RAY EVENTS WERE RECORDED, MOST OF WHICH WERE OPTICALLY UNCORRELATED. THE TWO LARGEST, A B7 AT 12/0409Z AND A B9 AT 12/0524Z WERE ACCOMPANIED BY STRONG DISCRETE AND SWEEP FREQUENCY RADIO BURSTS. NUMEROUS MODERATE TO STRONG SWEEP FREQUENCY EMISSIONS HAVE BEEN OBSERVED THIS ENTIRE PERIOD.  TWO WEAK TO MODERATE B-CLASS/SF FLARES WERE REPORTED FROM REGION 7722 (N07E81).  THIS DHO BETA SPOT GROUP APPEARS TO HAVE SOME DELTA CHARACTERISTICS, BUT IS STILL ROTATING ONTO THE DISK.  NEW REGION 7723 (N10E30) EMERGED EARLY THIS PERIOD AS A BXO BETA SPOT GROUP BUT HAS GROWN IN THE LAST FEW HOURS TO A DAO BETA.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: VERY LOW TO LOW.  BOTH REGIONS 7722 AND 7723 EXHIBITS GOOD POTENTIAL FOR C-CLASS ACTIVITY.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS.  THE GT 2 MEV ELECTRON FLUX LEVELS HAVE DECREASED TO THE HIGH RANGE.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED ON DAY ONE OF THE FORECAST PERIOD.  ON DAY'S TWO AND THREE, GEOMAGNETIC ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO INCREASE TO MOSTLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE WITH SOME MINOR STORM PERIODS.  THIS IS IN RESPONSE TO A FAVORABLY POSITIONED CORONAL HOLE.

sections.text: TO 23/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY CONTINUED AT A VERY LOW LEVEL. THE CURRENT DISK REGIONS EXHIBITED LITTLE EVOLUTION. THE LEADING EDGE OF THIS RECURRENT HOLE IS APPROXIMATELY ONE DAY BEHIND WHERE IT WAS LOCATED LAST ROTATION.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY SHOULD CONTINUE
sections.text: AT VERY LOW LEVELS FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS. NO REGIONS ARE DUE TO RETURN TO THE EAST LIMB DURING THAT TIME.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 22/2100Z TO 23/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET AT MID LATITUDES AND QUIET TO SLIGHTLY UNSETTLED AT HIGH LATITUDES. ENERGETIC ELECTRON FLUXES REMAINED AT MODERATE TO HIGH LEVELS. IT IS UNUSUAL FOR THESE FLUXES TO REMAIN ENHANCED AFTER THREE DAYS OF QUIET GEOMAGNETIC FIELD CONDITIONS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD
sections.text: SHOULD BE QUIET TO UNSETTLED FOR THE DURATION OF THE FORECAST PERIOD. THE NEXT SIGNIFICANT CORONAL HOLE DISTURBANCE IS EXPECTED TO BEGIN ON 29 MAY. THIS IS 28 DAYS AFTER THE ONSET OF THE LAST STORM FROM THIS HOLE. THE TIMING OF THIS FORECAST IS BASED UPON THE APPARENT SLOWER ROTATION RATE OF THIS HOLE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 23/2100Z TO 24/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS AT UNSETTLED TO MINOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE FIRST HALF OF THE PERIOD. QUIET TO UNSETTLED CONDITIONS WERE OBSERVED DURING THE LATTER HALF. THIS DISTURBANCE IS ATTRIBUTED TO A CORONAL HOLE IN THE NORTHWEST QUADRANT. THIS WAS THE FIRST ROTATION THIS HOLE PRODUCED A TERRESTRIAL DISTURBANCE. ENERGETIC ELECTRON FLUXES DROPPED TO A NORMAL BACKGROUND NEAR 24/0500Z.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD
sections.text: SHOULD BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE ON 25 MAY WITH SOME MINOR STORM CONDITIONS EXPECTED DURING LOCAL NIGHTTIMES. THE DISTURBANCE SHOULD THEN SUBSIDE SINCE THE SOURCE CORONAL HOLE IS ABOUT 2 DAYS (28 DEGREES) WIDE. MOSTLY UNSETTLED GEOMAGNETIC CONDITIONS ARE FORECAST FOR 26-27 MAY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 09/2100Z TO 10/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUITE VARIABLE DURING THE PERIOD. FROM 10/2100-11/0900Z, THE FIELD WAS QUIET TO UNSETTLED. GREATER THAN 2 MEV FLUXES WERE AT MOSTLY MODERATE TO HIGH LEVELS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD
sections.text: SHOULD BE DISTURBED FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS DUE TO A CORONAL HOLE RELATED HIGH SPEED SOLAR WIND STREAM. MOSTLY ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED DURING LOCAL NIGHTTIMES. UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS SHOULD BE EXPERIENCED DURING DAYLIGHT HOURS. SOME HIGH LATITUDES SITES MAY EXPERIENCE INTERVALS OF SEVERE STORMING.

sections.text: TO 12/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS VERY LOW. HOWEVER, AN 18 DEGREE FILAMENT LOCATED FROM ABOUT N07E01-S07W10 FADED BETWEEN APPROXIMATELY 12/1400-1630Z. A LONG DURATION B2 X-RAY ENHANCEMENT ACCOMPANIED THE ERUPTION. A TEMPORARY CORONAL HOLE WAS VISIBLE NEAR THE ERUPTION IN A HE 10830A SPECTROHELIOGRAM AT 1617Z. sections.text: SHOULD BE PREDOMINANTLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE FOR THE NEXT TWO DAYS. SOME SITES MAY EXPERIENCE MINOR TO MAJOR STORM PERIODS AS THE CORONAL HOLE RELATED DISTURBANCE SLOWLY SUBSIDES. sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 09/2100Z
sections.text: TO 10/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS VERY LOW.  REGION 7746 (N12W30) DECAYED SLIGHTLY IN WHITE LIGHT OVER THE PAST 24 HOURS.  THE REGION DISPLAYS THREE NEARLY-EQUAL PENUMBRAL AREAS WITH THE TRAILER POLARITY BETWEEN THE TWO LARGER AND DARKER PENUMBRAL AREAS.  REGION 7749 (S08W39) HAD SOME GROWTH THIS PERIOD.  7749 ACCOUNTED FOR TWO B-CLASS/SF FLARES WITH THE LARGEST, A B7, OCCURRING AT 10/0342Z.  SIX OTHER UNCORRELATED WEAK B-CLASS X-RAY EVENTS WERE REPORTED AT VARIOUS TIMES THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD.  NO OTHER SIGNIFICANT ACTIVITY WAS REPORTED.  THREE NEW REGIONS WERE NUMBERED THIS PERIOD.  REGION 7750 (S16W40) AND REGION 7751 (S12E57) EMERGED AS BXO BETA GROUPS.  REGION 7752 (N21W01) APPEARED AS A FAINT TWO-SPOT AXX GROUP BUT SINCE ITS NUMBERING, HAS DECAYED TO A SMALL, COMPACT AREA OF PLAGE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW.  DESPITE ITS SLIGHT DECAY, REGION 7746 STILL DISPLAYS GOOD POTENTIAL FOR C-CLASS AND POSSIBLE M-CLASS ACTIVITY. ANOTHER AREA WITH GOOD C AND POSSIBLE M-CLASS POTENTIAL IS THE TWO REGION COMPLEX 7749 AND 7750.  THEIR CLOSE PROXIMITY COULD PRODUCE SIGNIFICANT ACTIVITY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 10/2100Z
sections.text: TO 11/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS VERY LOW.  ACTIVITY THIS PERIOD CONSISTED OF 2 WEAK OPTICALLY UNCORRELATED B-CLASS X-RAY EVENTS AND A B6/SF FROM REGION 7749 (S09W53) OCCURRING AT 11/1002Z. IN WHITE LIGHT, THIS REGION HAS GROWN SLIGHTLY WHILE OVERALL SPOT COUNT HAS DECLINED.  JUST TO THE SOUTH, REGION 7750 (S17W55) HAS SHOWN THE MOST GROWTH OF ANY REGION ON THE DISK. THOUGH STACKED, BOTH REGIONS MAINTAIN A SIMPLE NORTH TO SOUTH MAGNETIC INVERSION LINE SO HAVE BEEN FAIRLY QUIET THE PAST 24 HOURS.  REGION 7746 (N11W44) ALSO INDICATED SOME GROWTH THIS PERIOD IN BOTH AREAL COVERAGE, SPOT COUNT AND MAG COMPLEXITY. YESTERDAY, 7746 HAD THREE DISTINCT PENUMBRAL AREAS BUT HAS SINCE LOST THE PENUMBRA AROUND THE LEADER SPOT GROUP WHILE FORMING A DELTA MAGNETIC CONFIGURATION IN THE TRAILER GROUP.  REGION 7753 (S12E68) WAS NUMBERED AS A SIMPLE AXX GROUP.  THE REMAINDER OF THE DISK AND LIMB WAS QUIET AND STABLE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW.  BOTH REGIONS 7746 AND 7750 DISPLAY GOOD POTENTIAL FOR C-CLASS AND POSSIBLE M-CLASS ACTIVITY.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD RANGED FROM UNSETTLED TO MINOR STORM LEVELS. ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS DOMINATED FROM THE BEGINNING OF THE PERIOD THROUGH 1500Z. sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE FOR THE NEXT 24 HOURS AS THE CURRENT DISTURBANCE CONTINUES. LOCAL NIGHTTIME HOURS ARE EXPECTED TO BE SUBJECT TO ISOLATED SUBSTORMS. CONDITIONS SHOULD DECLINE TO MOSTLY UNSETTLED LEVELS FOR THE SECOND AND THIRD DAYS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 11/2100Z
sections.text: TO 12/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS VERY LOW DURING THE PAST 24 HOURS. HOWEVER, NEW REGION 7765 (S11E17), A MAGNETICALLY COMPLEX D-TYPE GROUP, EMERGED RAPIDLY AFTER 12/0000Z. IT HAS PRODUCED 5 SUBFAINT FLARES, SOME WITH LOW-LEVEL X-RAY ENHANCEMENTS. TWO OTHER H-TYPE SPOT GROUPS ARE VISIBLE ON THE DISK. A DARK FILAMENT SEEN IN HE 1083 NM NEAR N25E25 ON 10 AUGUST WAS CONSIDERABLY REDUCED ON TODAY'S IMAGE. THERE WERE NO REPORTS OF ERUPTIVE LIMB ACTIVITY.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW BASED ON A GOOD PROBABILITY OF C-CLASS X-RAY FLARES FROM NEW REGION 7765. IF RAPID GROWTH CONTINUES, THERE IS A CHANCE OF AN ISOLATED MODERATE X-RAY FLARE. 2A.  GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 11/2100Z TO 12/2100Z: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN MOSTLY UNSETTLED FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS, ALTHOUGH ISOLATED QUIET AND ACTIVE PERIODS WERE ALSO OBSERVED. MODERATE LEVELS OF ENERGETIC ELECTRON FLUXES WERE OBSERVED AT GEOSYNCHRONOUS ORBIT.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO PERSIST AT PRIMARILY UNSETTLED LEVELS WITH ISOLATED PERIODS OF BOTH QUIET AND ACTIVE CONDITIONS. ENERGETIC ELECTRON FLUXES ARE EXPECTED TO DECREASE TOWARD NORMAL BACKGROUND VALUES.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 13/2100Z
sections.text: TO 14/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE DURING THE PAST 24 HOURS. REGION 7765 (S10W10) PRODUCED AN M3/1N FLARE MAXING AT 14/1738. THE FLARE WAS ACCOMPANIED BY RADIO BURSTS INCLUDING 210 FLUX UNITS AT 2695 MHZ (A TENFLARE OF 7 MINUTES DURATION) AND 170 FLUX UNITS AT 245 MHZ. SIX OTHER C-CLASS X-RAYS EVENTS WERE OBSERVED FROM 7765 DURING THIS REPORTING PERIOD. 7765 IS NOW EXTREMELY MAGNETICALLY COMPLEX (BETA GAMMA DELTA) AND HAS DOUBLED IN WHITE LIGHT SINCE YESTERDAY. NEW REGION 7766 (N10E47) EMERGED ON THE DISK AS A SMALL C-TYPE GROUP. SURGING WAS REPORTED ON THE WEST LIMB NEAR N06, THE LOCATION OF DEPARTING REGION 7762.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW. HOWEVER, REGION 7765 IS CAPABLE OF ADDITIONAL MODERATE (M-CLASS) X-RAY FLARES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 13/2100Z TO 14/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN MOSTLY ACTIVE WITH SOME PERIODS AT MINOR STORM LEVELS. THE SOURCE OF THIS DISTURBANCE IS UNKNOWN. HIGH FLUXES OF ENERGETIC ELECTRONS HAVE BEEN MEASURED AT GEOSYNCHRONOUS SATELLITE ALTITUDES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO PERSIST AT ACTIVE LEVELS TOMORROW, DECLINING TOWARD UNSETTLED CONDITIONS ON THE 16TH. A CORONAL MASS EJECTION POTENTIALLY ASSOCIATED WITH TODAY'S M3 TENFLARE COULD ARRIVE LATE ON THE 16TH OR EARLY ON THE 17TH, RESULTING IN RESUMED ACTIVE GEOMAGNETIC CONDITIONS BY THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD.

sections.text: TO 15/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE OWING TO AN M1/2N FLARE FROM REGION 7765 (S12W23) THAT MAXED AT 1251Z. sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN MOSTLY UNSETTLED FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. ISOLATED PERIODS AT ACTIVE LEVELS WERE OBSERVED AT HIGH GEOMAGNETIC LATITUDES. ENERGETIC ELECTRON FLUXES AT GEOSYNCHRONOUS ORBIT WERE HIGH.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TOMORROW AS THE DISTURBANCE OF THE PAST FEW DAYS SUBSIDES. A POSSIBLE NEW DISTURBANCE COULD BEGIN ON THE 17TH IN RESPONSE TO INTERPLANETARY EFFECTS WITH A LONG DURATION X-RAY EVENT NEAR THE CENTER OF THE SOLAR DISK ON 14 AUGUST.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 28/2100Z
sections.text: TO 29/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY INCREASED TO LOW LEVELS. A NEW REGION IS AT THE EAST LIMB NEAR S07. THIS REGION IS THE LIKELY SOURCE OF MULTIPLE C-CLASS FLARES - THE LARGEST WAS A C7 AT 29/1247Z. FREQUENT OPTICAL SURGING WAS OBSERVED FROM THIS SITE. THIS AREA IS ALSO MODERATELY LARGE AND BRIGHT IN YOHKOH IMAGERY. THIS IS A NEW REGION FROM LAST ROTATION AND IS LIKELY IN A GROWTH STAGE. A SMALL NEW HIGH LATITUDE REGION EMERGED AT S23E06 AND WAS NUMBERED AS NEW REGION 7772.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY SHOULD CONTINUE
sections.text: AT A LOW LEVEL WITH M-CLASS FLARES A DISTINCT POSSIBILITY. A MORE CONFIDENT ASSESSMENT WILL BE POSSIBLE WHEN THE REGION AT THE EAST LIMB ROTATES INTO VIEW.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD
sections.text: SHOULD CONTINUE AT MOSTLY QUIET LEVELS.

RECENT WHITE LIGHT OBSERVATIONS CLASSIFY THIS REGION AS A MODERATE SIZE F CLASS GROUP WITH SOME INTERIOR SPOT DISTRIBUTION. PLAGE INTENSITY WAS MODERATE TO HIGH. IT IS LIKELY THIS REGION IS IN A GROWTH PHASE DUE TO FLARE FREQUENCY AND PLAGE BRIGHTNESS.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY SHOULD BE
sections.text: MODERATE. THE POSSIBILITY OF AN X-CLASS FLARE FROM REGION 7773 EXISTS. A MORE CONFIDENT ASSESSMENT WILL BE POSSIBLE ONCE THE REGION ROTATES FARTHER ONTO THE DISK AND RELIABLE MAGNETIC DATA CAN BE OBTAINED.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET.

sections.text: SHOULD BE QUIET AT MID LATITUDES AND QUIET TO SLIGHTLY UNSETTLED AT HIGH LATITUDES.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 30/2100Z
sections.text: TO 31/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY RETURNED TO A LOW LEVEL. REGION 7773 (S08E61) PRODUCED FREQUENT C-CLASS FLARES. SOME REAL GROWTH OCCURRED (NOT JUST LACK OF FORESHORTENING) IN THIS REGION. MIXED MAGNETIC POLARITIES WERE VISIBLE IN THE CENTER OF THE REGION AND A WEAK DELTA MAY BE FORMING THERE. HOWEVER, THE REGION IS BASICALLY BIPOLAR. TOWARD THE END OF THE PERIOD, THE BACKGROUND X-RAY FLUX WAS DECREASING WHICH INDICATES A SLIGHT COOLING OF REGION 7773.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY SHOULD BE LOW TO
sections.text: MODERATE. REGION 7773 RETAINS THE CAPABILITY OF PRODUCING ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARES. AN X-CLASS FLARE FROM THIS REGION IS A SLIGHT POSSIBILITY. OLD REGION 7765 IS DUE BACK TO THE EAST LIMB ON 03 SEP. THIS REGION PRODUCED 5 M-CLASS AND 10 C-CLASS FLARES LAST ROTATION BUT WAS DECAYING IN THE WESTERN HEMISPHERE AND IS NOT EXPECTED TO BE AS ACTIVE THIS ROTATION.

sections.text: SHOULD BE QUIET TO SLIGHTLY UNSETTLED FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 31/2100Z
sections.text: TO 01/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY CONTINUED AT A LOW LEVEL. SEVERAL LOW C-CLASS FLARES WERE PRODUCED BY REGION 7773 (S08E49). MAGNETIC DATA TODAY INDICATE A BIPOLAR CONFIGURATION IN THIS REGION. THERE ARE SOME MIXED FIELDS IN THE CENTER OF THE REGION BUT THEY ARE WEAK. GROWTH APPEARED TO HAVE SLOWED OR CEASED AND SUBFLARE PRODUCTION WAS DOWN FROM PREVIOUS DAYS. A NEW REGION IS VISIBLE IN X-RAYS AT THE EAST LIMB NEAR N15. ALSO, A BROAD AREA OF X-RAY EMISSION IS VISIBLE ABOVE THE SOUTHEAST LIMB WHERE OLD REGION 7765 IS DUE ON 03 SEP. A CORONAL HOLE IS VISIBLE IN THE NORTHEAST QUADRANT. LAST ROTATION, THIS HOLE WAS OF SIMILAR SHAPE BUT CLOSER TO THE EQUATOR.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY SHOULD BE
sections.text: MOSTLY LOW. AN ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARE FROM REGION 7773 REMAINS A POSSIBILITY BUT AT A REDUCED PROBABILITY. LITTLE IS KNOWN ABOUT THE REGIONS AT OR NEAR THE EAST LIMB. AT THIS TIME, C-CLASS FLARES ARE EXPECTED FROM THESE LOCATIONS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 31/2100Z TO 01/2100Z:
sections.text: EARLY IN THE PERIOD (31/2100-2400Z) THE FIELD BECAME UNSETTLED. BETWEEN 01/0000-0300Z ACTIVE LEVELS WERE OBSERVED. THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD WAS QUIET TO UNSETTLED. THE SOURCE OF THIS BRIEF DISTURBANCE IS UNKNOWN.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD
sections.text: SHOULD BE QUIET TO UNSETTLED FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS. A RECURRENT CORONAL HOLE DISTURBANCE IS EXPECTED TO BEGIN AROUND 06 SEP.

sections.text: TO 02/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. TWO C-CLASS FLARES OCCURRED. THE FIRST WAS AN OPTICALLY UNCORRELATED C2 AT 02/1652Z. THE OTHER, ALSO C2, WAS OBSERVED AT THE EAST LIMB (NEAR S09) AT 02/2002Z. REGION 7773 (S07E35) REMAINS THE LARGEST AND MOST COMPLEX GROUP ON THE VISIBLE DISK BUT HAS NOT PRODUCED SIGNIFICANT FLARES SINCE YESTERDAY. A WEAK NOISE STORM AT 245 MHZ HAS BEEN IN PROGRESS FOR MOST OF THE DAY. THREE REGIONS WERE NUMBERED: 7774 (N11E47), 7775 (N14E73), AND 7776 (S07E67).

sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. ADDITIONAL C-CLASS FLARES ARE EXPECTED. AN ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARE IN REGION 7773 IS POSSIBLE.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS AT MIDDLE LATITUDES. A BRIEF EPISODE OF MINOR STORMING OCCURRED NEAR 10/0300Z. HIGH LATITUDE ACTIVITY RANGED FROM UNSETTLED TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS WITH MOST STORMING OBSERVED BETWEEN 10/0900-1500Z. THE STORMING WAS PROBABLY DUE TO CORONAL HOLE EFFECTS. THE GT 2 MEV ENERGETIC ELECTRON FLUX WAS IN THE HIGH RANGE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE DURING THE FIRST DAY WITH BRIEF PERIODS OF MINOR TO MAJOR STORMING POSSIBLE DURING LOCAL NIGHTTIMES. UNSETTLED CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED FOR THE BALANCE OF THE PERIOD.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 10/2100Z
sections.text: TO 11/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 7773 (S07W92) PRODUCED A LONG DURATION C8/SF FLARE AT 11/0505Z. THIS FLARE WAS ACCOMPANIED BY A WEAK TYPE II SWEEP BURST AND A LOOP PROMINENCE SYSTEM. ACTIVE SURGING WAS OBSERVED WITHIN THE REGION THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD. THE REMAINING REGIONS WERE STABLE. NEW REGION 7778 (S06W53) WAS ASSIGNED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: VERY LOW TO LOW. REGION 7773 COULD PRODUCE A C-CLASS FLARE FROM BEYOND THE WEST LIMB.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 10/2100Z TO 11/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS AT MIDDLE LATITUDES. HIGH LATITUDE CONDITIONS RANGED FROM QUIET TO MINOR STORM LEVELS. THE STORMING OCCURRED FROM 11/0600-1500Z AND WAS PROBABLY DUE TO CORONAL HOLE EFFECTS. A GT 10 MEV PROTON ENHANCEMENT FOLLOWED THE LONG DURATION FLARE MENTIONED ABOVE. THE ENHANCEMENT BEGAN NEAR 11/0700Z, REACHED A MAXIMUM OF 1.2 PFU AT 11/0935Z, AND RETURNED TO BACKGROUND LEVELS NEAR 11/1300Z. THE GT 2 MEV ENERGETIC ELECTRON FLUX WAS IN THE HIGH RANGE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS DURING THE FIRST TWO DAYS. BRIEF PERIODS OF ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS ARE ALSO POSSIBLE AT HIGH LATITUDES DURING LOCAL NIGHTTIMES. THE FIELD IS EXPECTED TO INCREASE TO ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS ON THE THIRD DAY IN RESPONSE TO THE LONG DURATION C8/SF FLARE MENTIONED ABOVE. PERIODS OF MAJOR STORMING WILL BE POSSIBLE AT HIGHER LATITUDES. AN ISOLATED SOUTHERN HEMISPHERIC CORONAL HOLE MAY AFFECT THE FIELD DURING THE FINAL DAY AS WELL.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 10/2100Z TO 11/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD RANGED FROM QUIET TO MINOR STORM. THIS DISTURBANCE WAS UNEXPECTED BUT IS PROBABLY DUE TO A CORONAL HOLE IN THE SOUTHWEST WHICH HAD A WEAK SIGNITURE IN HE 10830 SPECTROHELIOGRAMS. ENERGETIC ELECTRON FLUXES BEGAN THE PERIOD AT HIGH LEVELS THEN DROPPED TO MODERATE LEVELS AND LATE IN THE PERIOD RETURNED TO HIGH LEVELS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD
sections.text: SHOULD BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS DUE TO THE CORONAL HOLE IN THE SOUTHWEST QUADRANT. PERIODS OF MINOR STORMING ARE PROBABLE DURING THAT TIME, ESPECIALLY AT HIGH LATITUDES.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 17/2100Z
sections.text: TO 18/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS VERY LOW.  FOUR MODERATE B-CLASS X-RAY EVENTS OCCURRED THIS PERIOD, THREE OF WHICH WERE OPTICALLY UNCORRELATED.  THE LARGEST EVENT, A B8/1F, MAXED AT 18/1725Z AND WAS ASSOCIATED WITH REGION 7790 (N11W12).  THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD SAW WEAK LOW FREQUENCY RADIO EMISSIONS. REGION 7788 ROTATED AROUND THE WEST LIMB AT S02.  TWO NEW REGIONS WERE NUMBERED THIS PERIOD; REGION 7791 (S11W38) AS A CRO BETA AND REGION 7792 (S06E69) AS A DAO BETA.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 18/2100Z
sections.text: TO 19/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW.  AN M1 X-RAY EVENT WAS STILL IN PROGRESS AFTER FORECAST TIME.  THE EVENT FIRST HIT M1 AT 19/2102Z.  THIS EVENT WAS OPTICALLY CORRELATED WITH A LARGE RIBBON FLARE FROM RGN 7790 (N11W26).  THIS FLARE WAS SEEN BRIEFLY IN A BREAK IN THE CLOUDS FROM CULGOORA, AUSTRALIA. ASSOCIATED WITH THIS EVENT WAS A TENFLARE BURST OF 93 SFU WHICH MAXED AT 19/2103Z AND REPORTS OF A TYPE II SWEEP WITH A RANGE OF 25-85MHZ AND AN ESTIMATED SHOCK VELOCITY OF 1000 KM/SEC.  NO OTHER SIGNIFICANT ACTIVITY OCCURRED DURING THE PERIOD.  REGION 7790 CONTINUES ITS SLOW DECAY WHILE REGION 7792 (S07E57) CONTINUES TO ROTATE INTO FULL VIEW ONTO THE DISK.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW.  REGION 7790 IS EXPECTED TO PRODUCE MORE C-CLASS ACTIVITY WITH AN ISOLATED CHANCE OF M-CLASS ACTIVITY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 19/2100Z
sections.text: TO 20/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 7790 (N11W39) PRODUCED AN M3/1F TENFLARE AT THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD YESTERDAY. THIS TURNED OUT TO BE A PROTON PRODUCING FLARE THAT MAXED AT 35 PFU GREATER THAN 10 MEV AT 20/0340Z. THERE WAS NO OTHER SIGNIFICANT ACTIVITY NOTED. NO NEW REGIONS WERE NUMBERED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: VERY LOW TO LOW. REGION 7790 HAS A GOOD CHANCE OF PRODUCING C-CLASS FLARES AND AN OUTSIDE CHANCE OF PRODUCING ANOTHER ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARE. REGION 7792 (S08E47) ALSO APPEARS TO HAVE C-CLASS FLARE POTENTIAL.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE FOR THE NEXT 24 HOURS, THEN ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST PERIOD. HIGH LATITUDE STATIONS ARE EXPECTED TO SEE MINOR TO SEVERE STORMING DURING THE LAST 2 DAY'S OF THE FORECAST PERIOD. ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED AS AN EFFECT OF THE APPARENT CORONAL MASS EJECTION ASSOCIATED WITH THE M3/1F FLARE IN REGION 7790.

sections.text: TO 25/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 7792 (S06W23) PRODUCED A C4/0F WITH STRONG TYPE II AT 1009Z. MODEST DISCRETE BURSTS ACROSS THE RADIO SPECTRUM ACCOMPANIED THE EVENT. THE REGION HAS BEEN QUIET SINCE. A NEW REGION ROTATED FULLY INTO VIEW, 7794 (N15E69).

sections.text: VERY LOW TO LOW. AN ISOLATED C-CLASS FLARE IS POSSIBLE FROM EITHER OF THE TWO SPOTTED REGIONS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 24/2100Z TO 25/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD VARIED FROM QUIET TO MINOR STORM LEVELS, WITH THE MOST DISTURBED TIMES OCCURRING DURING LOCAL NIGHTTIMES. AN ENHANCEMENT IN THE GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTON FLUX BEGAN AROUND 1100Z, JUST AFTER THE C4 FLARE. THE PEAK FLUX SEEN WAS NEAR 1 PFU. THE GREATER THAN 2 MEV ELECTRON FLUX WAS AT HIGH LEVELS ALL DAY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED FOR THE NEXT 36 HOURS. A SHOCK RELATED TO TODAY'S ACTIVITY FROM REGION 7792 IS EXPECTED TO BRING ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM CONDITIONS THE LATTER HALF OF THE PERIOD.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 25/2100Z
sections.text: TO 26/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS VERY LOW. HOWEVER, THE CHARACTER OF THE DISK HAS CHANGED SUBSTANTIALLY WITH THE ADDITION OF THREE NEW SPOT GROUPS IN THE SOUTHEAST. THE NEW REGIONS ARE 7795 (S17E37), 7796 (S06E47), AND 7797 (S09E70). ALL HAVE BEEN QUIET TO THIS POINT. REGION 7794 (N15E60) FULLY REVEALS ITSELF TO BE A RELATIVELY LARGE AND EXTENDED GROUP WITH A SLIGHT DEGREE OF MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY. IT PRODUCED A SUBFLARE RECENTLY.

sections.text: LOW THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD. SOME C-CLASS ACTIVITY, ESPECIALLY FROM REGION 7794, IS LIKELY.

sections.text: TO 28/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY CONTINUED AT A VERY LOW LEVEL. REGION 7794 (N16E36) PRODUCED A SMALL B-CLASS SUBFLARE. HOWEVER, GROWTH OCCURRED IN THE INTERIOR AND TRAILER SPOTS DURING THE PERIOD. MAGNETICALLY, THIS REGION REMAINED BASICALLY BIPOLAR WITH SOME NEUTRAL LINE KINKS IN THE TRAILER.

sections.text: MOSTLY LOW WITH REGION 7794 BEGINNING TO PRODUCE C-CLASS FLARES. ISOLATED M-CLASS EVENTS ARE POSSIBLE FROM THIS REGION SHOULD GROWTH CONTINUE AND/OR MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY DEVELOP.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 27/2100Z TO 28/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET TO SLIGHTLY UNSETTLED. IT IS UNLIKELY THAT THE CORONAL MASS EJECTION RELATED DISTURBANCE WILL MATERIALIZE AT THIS LATE TIME. ENERGETIC ELECTRON FLUXES WERE AT MODERATE TO HIGH LEVELS DURING THE PERIOD.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD
sections.text: SHOULD BE QUIET TO UNSETTLED FOR MOST OF 29 OCT. A RECURRENT CORONAL HOLE RELATED DISTURBANCE IS EXPECTED TO BEGIN LATE ON 29 OCT OR EARLY ON 30 OCT AND CONTINUE THROUGH 03 NOV. MOSTLY ACTIVE CONDITIONS ARE FORECAST DURING THAT TIME BUT OCCASIONAL MINOR STORM AND ISOLATED MAJOR STORM INTERVALS ARE POSSIBLE DURING THAT PERIOD.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 28/2100Z
sections.text: TO 29/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY BECAME LOW DUE TO A C1/SF FLARE AT 29/0437Z FROM REGION 7794 (N15E22). THIS REGION STABILIZED AND ONLY MINOR MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY WAS OBSERVED. A SMALL H CLASS SUNSPOT ROTATED OVER THE LIMB AND WAS NUMBERED AS NEW REGION 7798 (S12E77). TWO MODERATE SIZE FILAMENTS NEAR S15E00 FADED DURING THE PERIOD.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY SHOULD CONTINUE
sections.text: AT MOSTLY LOW LEVELS DUE TO C-CLASS FLARE PRODUCTION FROM REGION 7794. THERE IS A SLIGHT POSSIBILITY OF A SMALL M-CLASS FLARE FROM THIS REGION.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 28/2100Z TO 29/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD BEGAN THE PERIOD QUIETLY. HOWEVER, A SUDDEN IMPULSE OF 24 GAMMA WAS OBSERVED AT 29/0025Z. THIS IS ATTRIBUTED TO A LONG DURATION EVENT THAT OCCURRED ON 25/1000Z FOR A LENGTHY 86 HOUR DELAY. THE FIELD BECAME ACTIVE SHORTLY AFTER THE IMPULSE AND MINOR TO SEVERE STORM CONDITIONS FOLLOWED IN THE 0900-1800Z PERIOD. SOME HIGH LATITUDE SITES EXPERIENCED K INDICES OF 9 IN THE 1200-1500Z INTERVAL. A BRIEF MAGNETOPAUSE CROSSING WAS OBSERVED AT GOES-7 (112W) BETWEEN 29/1430-1433Z. AT THE END OF THE PERIOD, THE FIELD HAD CALMED TO UNSETTLED LEVELS. ENERGETIC ELECTRON FLUXES BEGAN THE PERIOD AT HIGH LEVELS BUT DROPPED TO NORMAL BACKGROUND VALUES BY 29/0300Z.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD
sections.text: SHOULD BE AT ACTIVE TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS FOR 30 OCT. AS THE CURRENT DISTURBANCE EBBS, IT WILL BE REPLACED BY A CORONAL HOLE RELATED ONE. UNSETTLED TO MINOR STORM CONDITIONS SHOULD BE EXPERIENCED THROUGH 03 NOV AS A RESULT OF THAT HIGH SPEED STREAM. ENERGETIC ELECTRON FLUXES SHOULD RETURN TO HIGH LEVELS AROUND 01 NOV.

sections.text: LOW AS REGION 7794 IS CAPABLE OF PRODUCING OCCASIONAL C-CLASS FLARES. THE POSSIBILITY OF THIS REGION PRODUCING AN M-CLASS FLARE IS DIMINISHING.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 29/2100Z TO 30/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD BEGAN THE PERIOD AT UNSETTLED LEVELS. AFTER 30/0300Z, ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM CONDITIONS BEGAN AND CONTINUED FOR MOST OF THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD. MAJOR STORMING WAS OBSERVED IN PLANETARY INDICES BETWEEN 30/0900-1200Z. THE CHARACTER AND TIMING OF THIS DISTURBANCE ARGUE STRONGLY THAT THE EXPECTED CORONAL HOLE RELATED DISTURBANCE HAS ARRIVED. ENERGETIC ELECTRON FLUXES WERE AT NORMAL BACKGROUND LEVELS UNTIL NEAR 30/1500Z WHEN A RAPID RISE TO MOSTLY HIGH LEVELS WAS OBSERVED.

sections.text: SHOULD BE AT MOSTLY ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS. OCCASIONAL PERIODS OF MAJOR STORMING ARE POSSIBLE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 25/2100Z
sections.text: TO 26/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW.  REGION 7811 (S17W11) SHOWED DRAMATIC GROWTH IN THE PAST 24 HOURS EVOLVING FROM A DAO BETA WITH TWO SPOTS TO A EAI BETA-GAMMA WITH 21 SPOTS.  THIS PERIOD, RGN 7811 PRODUCED THREE C-CLASS FLARES.  THE LARGEST EVENT WAS A C2/0N WHICH MAXED AT 26/2023Z.  NUMEROUS LOWER FREQUENCY RADIO EMISSIONS WERE ALSO OBSERVED THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD. THE LARGEST OF THESE WAS A BURST OF 1800SFU OBSERVED ON 245 MHZ AT 26/1849Z.  THIS BURST WAS ASSOCIATED WITH A B8/SF FROM RGN 7811.  NO OTHER SIGNIFICANT ACTIVITY NOTED ON THE REMAINDER OF THE DISK AND LIMB.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW.  REGION 7811 IS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE PRODUCING C-CLASS ACTIVITY WITH A REMOTE CHANCE OF M-CLASS ACTIVITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 25/2100Z TO 26/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO SEVERE STORM LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS.  LEVELS ROSE DRAMATICALLY TO STORM CONDITIONS ABOUT 26/1030Z AND HAS REMAINED AT MINOR TO SEVERE LEVELS SINCE.  THIS ACTIVITY IS BELIEVED TO BE IN RESPONSE TO A FAVORABLY POSITIONED RECURRENT CORONAL HOLE FEATURE.  THE GREATER THAN 2 MEV ENERGETIC ELECTRON FLUX AT GEOSYNCHRONOUS ALTITUDES WAS MOSTLY NORMAL WITH MODERATE LEVELS EARLY IN THE PERIOD.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM CONDITIONS FOR THE NEXT 48 HOURS.  LEVELS ARE EXPECTED TO DECLINE TO MOSTLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE BY DAY THREE OF THE PERIOD.

sections.text: TO 30/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS VERY LOW. REGION 7811 (S17W68) RE-DEVELOPED INTO A DAO SPOT GROUP AND PRODUCED NINE B-CLASS FLARES, THE LARGEST OF WHICH WAS A B7/SF FLARE AT 30/1930Z. THIS IS THE ONLY SPOTTED REGION ON THE DISK AT THIS TIME.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: VERY LOW TO LOW. REGION 7811 HAS A FAIR CHANCE OF PRODUCING ISOLATED C-CLASS FLARE ACTIVITY AND AN OUTSIDE CHANCE OF AN ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 29/2100Z TO 30/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. HIGH LATITUDE STATIONS EXPERIENCED A SHORT PERIOD OF MAJOR STORMING FROM 30/0900 TO 30/1200Z. ACTIVITY WAS MOST LIKELY THE RESULT OF A POSSIBLE CORONAL MASS EJECTION AS INDICATED BY AN IMPULSIVE C2/1N FLARE WITH A TYPE II SWEEP ON 27/1617Z. THE GREATER THAN 2 MEV ENERGETIC ELECTRON FLUX AT GEOSYNCHRONOUS ALTITUDES WAS MODERATE TO HIGH.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE FOR THE FIRST DAY AND A HALF OF THE FORECAST PERIOD DUE TO A FAVORABLY POSITIONED CORONAL HOLE. ACTIVITY SHOULD DIMINISH TO QUIET TO UNSETTLED FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD. HIGH LATITUDE STATIONS MAY SEE SHORT PERIODS OF MINOR TO MAJOR STORMING, ESPECIALLY DURING LOCAL NIGHTTIME, FOR THE NEXT 36 HOURS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 15/2100Z TO 16/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT MOSTLY QUIET TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS.  ISOLATED PERIODS OF MINOR STORM CONDITIONS WERE OBSERVED AT HIGH LATITUDE STATIONS DURING LOCAL NIGHTTIME.  A FAVORABLY POSITIONED RECURRENT CORONAL HOLE IS BELIEVED BE TO RESPONSIBLE FOR THE ELEVATED LEVELS.  THE GREATER THAN 2 MEV ELECTRON FLUX WAS AT NORMAL TO MODERATE BACKGROUND LEVELS UNTIL 16/1700UT WHEN THE LEVELS REACHED HIGH.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED, AT THE MIDDLE LATITUDES, ON DAY ONE AND MOSTLY QUIET FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD.  HIGH LATITUDES WILL EXPERIENCE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE CONDITIONS FOR THE FIRST DAY AND MOSTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED THEREAFTER.

sections.text: TO 17/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW.  REGION 7815 (S11W54) PRODUCED THE LARGEST EVENT OF THE PERIOD, A C1/1N AT 16/2223UT. sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 28/2100Z
sections.text: TO 29/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS AT VERY LOW LEVELS. THE LARGEST FLARE WAS AN OPTICALLY UNCORRELATED B8, AT 0630UT. REGION 7817 (S03W90) AND 7818 (S11W93) HAVE ROTATED OFF THE DISK, BUT REGION 7817 PRODUCED AN ERUPTIVE PROMIENCE ON THE LIMB AT 1604UT.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 28/2100Z TO 29/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN MOSTLY UNSETTLED. A STRATWARM ALERT EXIST, WARMING OVER THE NORTHEASTERN AND CENTRAL SIBERIA SPREADING NORTHEASTWARDS.
